newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia sells 30.3 mln kuna 42-day T-bills.
newsitem.headline: Croatia sells 30.3 mln kuna 42-day T-bills.

text.p: Croatia's Finance Ministry said on Tuesday it raised 30.3 million kuna through 42-day treasury bills at an unchanged rate of 11 percent.
The issue was priced at 98,750 kuna.
The ministry had offered 90 million kuna T-bills, but bids fell way short of the targeted amount. Some 51 percent of the bidders came from the banking sector, it said in a statement.
The weighted average was 10.99 percent. The bills are payable in two days and mature on February 20.
Croatia will next auction 100 million kuna worth of 42-day bills on January 21.
